tool.name: Seurat FindVariableGenes
tool.command:
seurat-find-variable-genes.R
--input-object-file '$input' #if $mean: --mean-function '$mean' #end if #if $disp: --dispersion-function $disp #end if #if $xlow: --x-low-cutoff $xlow #end if #if $xhigh: --x-high-cutoff $xhigh #end if #if $ylow: --y-low-cutoff $ylow #end if #if $yhigh: --y-high-cutoff $yhigh #end if --output-object-file '$output' --output-text-file '$output_tab'
tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
Seurat_ is a toolkit for quality control, analysis, and exploration of single cell RNA sequencing data. It is developed and maintained by the `Satija Lab`_ at NYGC. Seurat aims to enable users to identify and interpret sources of heterogeneity from single cell transcriptomic measurements, and to integrate diverse types of single cell data.
This tool finds variable genes.
-----
**Inputs**
* Seurat RDS object
-----
**Outputs**
* Seurat RDS object * Tabular file of variable genes
.. _Seurat: https://www.nature.com/articles/nbt.4096 .. _Satija Lab: https://satijalab.org/seurat/
